original_title: The Owls Have Grown as Big as the Half Moon
overview: A trip to South Korea, searching for memories from early childhood, spent there between the age of 1-3. Memories that barely exist. Layers of strangeness blend together: being a foreigner in the country and the strangeness vis-a-vis the past and the own biography. Wandering in the gaps, in between the noise and silences.
title: The Owls Have Grown as Big as the Half Moon
